formalText: Patient comes in saying "Right now, I'm great"
At the end of the session, patient completed a good long breathing practice and some relaxation.
Taught her a breathing exercise in mindfulness
for brief moment of respite from her worries
Talked about getting Josh into a meditation center
and she replied he dislikes restorative yoga
Will see her in two weeks or week and a half after Friday at 3:30
Patient comes in for her weekly session and she says "It's been a terrible week".
She felt depressed and upset about her friend leaving
She talks mostly about her boyfriend's heart condition.
She feels she have to cope with his heart which isn't a good place to be because in some ways it's a little bit easier because Josh has no choice but to cope with his condition
She wants to have answers of what the future will hold with these different treatments
She feels frustrated about having to be really supportive.
She has lots of things to do with him but she goes a little stir crazy week after week.
She didn't get great news from the doctor and her friend left.
She sleeps a lot when she is sad. This mood has been short term so doesn't seem like depression
Her boyfriend got cardioverted on Tuesday, and they said that his heart was like four times the size.
Doctor said he probably has a genetically large heart.

Yeah, they also they gave him an extra drugs to lower his heart rate even more and if it goes blowing up, there is like a built-in Peacemaker that your heart will kick in and he kind of has it naturally because his heart rate is so low, they call it become junctional rhythm.
And he woke up in the middle of the night feeling like he had just been shocked the second night.
Talked about treatments like stem cell trials for his heart.
Talked about how the heart procedure went
Josh had a a terrible day with his heart condition and then at night had a talk with his mom and it was a really painful conversation to listen to I'm not sure he didn't even talk to me about it.
She used to be able to believe this illusion that things were under your control because you hadn't yet come up against something that she couldn't control
His whole world revolved around Sports and his fellow athletes before the accident
She didn't feel anxious or have trouble sleeping.
She says her strong feelings make her feel crazy.
